Package honeyroasted.jype

Interface Type

All Known Subinterfaces:
TypeConcrete
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractType, TypeAnd, TypeArray, TypeDeclaration, TypeIn, TypeMethodDeclaration, TypeNone, TypeNull, TypeOr, TypeOut, TypeParameter, TypeParameter.Fresh, TypeParameterized, TypePrimitive
public interface Type
This interface represents any type in the Java type system.

  • Method Details

    • toSignature

      TypeString toSignature(TypeString.Context context)
      Generates the TypeString of this Type's Java Virtual Machine signature under the given TypeString.Context. Some types may not have a valid signature under the given TypeString.Context, and will return an unsuccessful TypeString.
      Parameters:
      context - The context under which this Type is being converted to a String
      Returns:
      The TypeString representation of this Type's signature
      See Also:
      • TypeString.Context

    • toDescriptor

      TypeString toDescriptor(TypeString.Context context)
      Generates the TypeString of this Type's Java Virtual Machine descriptor under the given TypeString.Context. Some types may not have a valid descriptor under the given TypeString.Context, and will return an unsuccessful TypeString.
      Parameters:
      context - The context under which this Type is being converted to a String
      Returns:
      The TypeString representation of this Type's descriptor
      See Also:
      • TypeString.Context

    • toSource

      TypeString toSource(TypeString.Context context)
      Generates the TypeString of this Type's source representation under the given TypeString.Context. Some types may not have a valid source representation under the given TypeString.Context, and will return an unsuccessful TypeString.
      Parameters:
      context - The context under which this Type is being converted to a String
      Returns:
      The TypeString representation of this Type's source
      See Also:
      • TypeString.Context

    • toReadable

      TypeString toReadable(TypeString.Context context)
      Generates the TypeString of this Type's human-readable representation under the given TypeString.Context. All types should have a human-readable representation, and the returned TypeString should always be successful.
      Parameters:
      context - The context under which this Type is being converted to a String
      Returns:
      The TypeString representation of this Type's source
      See Also:
      • TypeString.Context

    • typeSystem

      TypeSystem typeSystem()
      Returns:
      The TypeSystem associated with this Type

    • lock

      default void lock()
      Locks this Type, making it immutable. Note that this does not necessarily lock the child Types of compound types such as TypeAnd. Since Type hierarchies can contain circular references, it may be necessary to instantiate Types, build their values, and then lock them to maintain immutability.

    • kind

      default String kind()
